description:
Two words:    panna cotta

Adorable neighborhood restaurant that's nice enough for a date, yet comfortably casual enough to walk into for a spontaneous "nothing in my refrig" dinner.
Their gnocchi was light and delicious, my friends salmon was super moist and yummy.
The service is warm and friendly, yet very efficient.
And to repeat myself, their panna cotta is fantastic.
I could come in for just their panna cotta alone.  Creamy and rich and so smooth.
They're a little hard to spot from the street, as there's no large sign or markings.  Look for the stone/brick clad front, and trellis and vines.
Once you've eaten here once, there'll be no trouble remembering where it is the next time.
author: bb b.

description:
As Italian restaurants go the food here is pretty average. Of course, it was our first time and we only tried one antipasti - the eggplant, which was good and could actually make a main course given its size, and two pasta dishes. 

As for the two pasta dishes we tried, the ravioli sauce is a tomato cream sauce. I'm more of a real tomato sauce fan rather than cream sauce as the cream sauces tend to grow "old" quickly as you eat them (i.e., too much / too rich).  The house made pasta with pesto sauce was our second dish. Again, generally speaking pesto sauce is good, but when you have a whole, large dish of it, it also becomes too much. 

Desserts - affogato and sorbet, good, but once again, too large for our tastes.  

Now, I will admit, we live in Tokyo much of the year and truly, it is very, very difficult to beat the quality of Tokyo's many Italian restaurants. There are a few restaurants in San Francisco that can match or better those Tokyo restaurants, but unfortunately, Manzoni is not one of them. Portions at Manzoni are too large; we've found, over the last few years, that many San Francisco restaurants are cutting down a bit on the portions - too many "doggy bags" get taken home and in many cases, I suspect, thrown out within a day or two. 

On the plus side, the service is friendly and on a Sunday night there were only a few people there so the noise level was very good. 

We're willing to give it a second chance and next time we'll try one of the chef's special dishes for the day or perhaps the risotto, which they told us is plenty big for two to share for a meal (again, those big portions?).
author: Joe P.

description:
Those that take an interest in the San Francisco real estate market cannot help but notice the insanity of Glen Park homes: it appears that the tech bros want to set stake here (https://sf.curbed.com/2018/4/25/17277290/glen-park-home-expensive-over-asking-price).

And while the house market is red hot the dinning options in Glen Park are anything but. 

Manzoni is one of the solid offerings in this here neck of the woods. Manzoni serves very good Italian comfort food in an adorable setting. Service is good and on point  ( our waiter was the same guy from two nights ago at Ristorante Milano on Russian Hill...talk about hard working people!!!)

Manzoni offers fresh salads with unique combinations ( Loved the shaved fennel with olives and oranges). 

Homemade pastas were great...my pappardelle was served in a rich ragu with pork. Really delicious.

Main dishes were also well executed. The tiger prawns were not overcooked and had a wonderful charred flavor. The steak in truffle sauce was perfectly medium rare not over sauced.

Good wine list.

If you are in this area Manzoni is a solid choice for good Italian dinning.
author: David G.

description: An intimate hole-in-the-wall restaurant to enjoy some homemade Italian food. The parppadelle pork ragu was highly recommended, and now I can see why! Such a light dish, yet full of flavor. The braised pork just melts in your mouth and the pasta is cooked al dente! Must try; you won't be disappointed :)
author: Jamie C.

description:
True Italian vibes. Good food and wine. 

Make a reservation. 

This place is totes cute with nice Italian decor and music. The small, intimate setting is picturesque for a romantic date. Seating is limited. 

The burrata appetizer is exceptionally fresh. Their huge helping of fresh burrata is placed upon roasted red peppers, micro greens, and salty prosciutto. Hearty portion split between two. So satisfying and delicious I could probably eat it everyday. Would definitely recommend and order again. 

My friend had the roasted chicken with potatoes and greens. It was moist and tasty. I ordered the rigatoni with Italian sausage, roasted red peppers in a tomato cream sauce. It was al dente and well seasoned. Came out exactly as it said on the menu and lived up to what pasta should taste like. Loved the Chianti and house bread. Wish our server gave us more! 

The Italian lady serving us was charming and lovely. She made us feel welcomed and happy to be there. One of the servers smelled intensely like cigarettes and gave us a hard time about our Christmas gifts.
author: Rosalyn W.

description: The staff was amazing, the food, not so much.  Seafood was not fresh, neither was the pasta.  I had high hopes for the pappardelle, but it was stiff lacked flavor.
author: D. S.

description: An Italian restaurant with a family vibe. The waiters are super nice and friendly. I recommend their shrimp dish and anything dessert, especially the affogato.
author: Theresa Thao N.

description:
Pretty good local family comfort restaurant. 

Gnocchi was pretty good. Simple. Truffle flavor was good. Could use more salt and truffles. It was a bit one note (cream) so as a main dish it might be a little too much of one thing. No veggies. No meat. Just soft pillowy gnocchi. 

Pappardelle with pork ragu- good noodles. Good meat flavor. But overall could use a bit more flavor. Salt pepper. Not sure what else but also a little one note but it was a good sauce to be one note. 

Fettuccine with clams.  Pasta was over cooked. And not a round complex flavor. 

Tiramisu was good. Really good. Light. Tasty. Not too alcoholic. Not too chocolate. Nothing overpowering. Strange to call tiramisu light but it was. And super enjoyable. 

They don't have a lot of servers (2+ a runner maybe in a Saturday night) so service wasn't always prompt but friendly. 

Small interior ~40 people plus a few bar seats. Tables are very close together. 

Street parking 

Single bathroom in the back. Big and clean. But one.
author: Traci H.

description:
One great dish, one disappointing one, and erratic service do not a memorable evening make. Gee, it's like I gave away the whole plot in the first sentence, but I thought I'd cut to the chase since attention spans are getting so minuscule in the age of social media. Too bad since the signs prior to my recent virginal visit would indicate this could be the hidden jewel of Glen Park, a neighborhood with a lot more dining options than I always expect. This one is up on the second block of Diamond from the BART station just as the area starts to feel totally residential. The stone entryway gave way to a compact dining room.

The space was half full when I arrived by myself and fortunately there was a small table next to the front window just for me. Sometimes I wonder if the staff is immediately disappointed to see a solitary diner at a table for two. I definitely got that impression the minute I sat down. The server was quite chatty with the large, mouthy parties and even the couple seated next to me, offering suggestions on the menu, the wine and so forth. He barely said anything to me, just left the menu, some bread and olive oil (photo: http://bit.ly/2kzF16o) and came back about five minutes later to take my order.

Gee, I didn't think I was giving off an anti-social vibe, but it did throw me back to the dance in the gym at my high school when no one wanted to do the electric slide with me. Anyway, I ordered the $11 Insalata di Finocchio e Arancia, a refreshing plate of shaved fennel, orange segments, and shaved parmigiano reggiano doused in extra virgin olive oil and accessorized with black olives (photo: http://bit.ly/2kzJqpK). This was a terrific house salad with the fennel providing just the right crunch compared to the sweetness of the orange. I'd come back for that. For my entree, I decided to go with the $19 Pappardelle con Brasato di Maiale.

A hearty dish indeed with big chunks of braised pork ragu wrapped around the thick pappardelle noodles (photo: http://bit.ly/2kgZWPq). This one didn't work for me. First, it was lukewarm. Second, the pork pieces were too big to savor with the pasta and required further cutting up. Third, the braise yielded just a watery base, not a thicker sauce that could have lent warmth to the dish. I was thinking dessert would be nice, a little tiramisu perhaps, but I never found out since the server never asked and simply left the check for me as soon as my plate was taken away. OK, I get the hint.

FOOD - 3 stars...the fennel and orange salad was excellent, the pasta less so
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...actually a charming space
SERVICE - 2 stars...well, I don't know what I did wrong
TOTAL - 3 stars...saved by the salad
author: Ed U.

description:
The bread was ok. Would've been nice if it was warm:)

Cute little hideaway restaurant in Glen Park, perfect for date night. A charming Italian gentleman was our waiter. He recommended the gnocchi, and omg, our mouths partied hard. The sauce was unbelievable. Nice wine selection. 

Time for dessert, and again, they killed it. They served us the fluffiest, creamiest cloud of tiramisu. We devoured it, and wanted to order another slice, but self-control took over. 

We will definitely be back!
author: Gabriela W.

description: This place is super cute and romantic - awesome place for date night  my favorite item on the menu is the pesto hands down. So so delicious! And the tiramisu for dessert. The staff is super friendly and attentive as well.
author: Stefanie M.

description:
I came here for my girlfriends birthday and this place was actually not bad ! It's a small place but food is overall pretty good. The location is not bad but you can easily miss it since its so small . I suggest to make reservations as I noticed a lot of people come here to eat. 

My friends and I decided to share a few appetizers. We ordered the clams, Parma Prosciutto, and carpaccio. All three were great, portions are a bit small but it was enough for 5 girls and two of which didn't eat salad or raw foods. 

For my main dish I ordered the Fettuccine Alle Vongole and I wasn't bad but it was not the best. I felt the pasta sauce was a bit water downed and again portions weren't huge. My friends on the other hand ordered the Rigatoni Alla Bischero and it was good. Their meat sauce was cooked great and if I were to come back I would order that. 

All in all service was great and food was ok. Parking can be a bit challenging depending on what time you go. I would definitely come back.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
I have been wanting to try Manzoni for months but was hesitant since I knew it was a very small restaurant, and sometimes restaurants like that give me anxiety because I have a service dog which can be uncomfortable to bring into a small restaurant because it's harder to be inconspicuous and ppl can be really mean and awful when they assume you have a pet. Luckily we were seated back towards the kitchen by their small bar, so it was actually quite Private. When we return, I would ask for that table again, or one of the tables in the window nook.

There were two servers working that night and ours (a female with long blond hair and an accent) was so sweet and friendly. The man who was the other server was not quite as friendly, so we were really happy that we lucked out with our server. I couldn't find an appetizer that fully appealed to us. They have an eggplant roll up that contains goat cheese but my dining companion doesn't like goat cheese. None of the salads really sounded super appealing and I found them to be a tiny bit overpriced. I was hesitant to get the polenta because neither of us like bleu cheese and it contains Gorgonzola but when the server came I sort of just pulled the trigger and ordered the polenta. It's a small ramekin and we shared it by each taking one spoonful and then having a second spoonful each. Both of our first spoons full were excellent. The mushrooms were the star of the show, the polenta was creamy and the cheese was very very mild. I was not able to even detect the Gorgonzola in the first bite. But the second helping was where all the Gorgonzola was contained and I think we both agreed that it was really overpowering. If you like Gorgonzola than this dish would be a five out of five for you, but for me it was just too funky so I wouldn't order it again. 

The two dishes I was really interested to try were the rigatoni bischero and the gnocchi.  Lucky for me, my dining companion wanted the rigatoni so I went ahead and ordered the gnocchi. Both the dishes were excellent, I'm actually not even sure, in hindsight, which one I liked better. Following the creamy polenta, I think the rigatoni was more of a switch up in flavors, so at the time I really enjoyed that. But in hindsight the gnocchi were some of the best I've ever had. The sauce was creamy and cheesy with black truffles and really lovely Parmesan flavor. The actual gnocchi were so light and pillowy and had exactly the delicate flavor that I always look for in gnocchi and don't often find. The rigatoni has a meat sauce that's finished with some cream. It's silky, tomatoey and incredibly flavorful with a velvet creamy mouth feel. If I could change one thing about this dish, the vegetable in it would be something other than green peas. The sauce was slightly sweet and peas are very sweet; I really thought it would've been better complemented by something more bitter or at least less sweet than a pea. Don't give me wrong though, it's fantastic as-is.  I would highly recommend both of these dishes. 

Unfortunately, one thing that makes this restaurant more of a special occasion spot than a weeknight dinner place is the wine list. I'm pretty sure that the least expensive glass of wine was $12. I opted for a bottle of Sangiovese say that was $60. The wine was fabulous, and I really enjoyed everything about evening, but I would love to be able to come to Manzoni much more often, but if you like to drink the way I do during a cozy and romantic dinner (at least two glasses) Manzoni will get pricey. One should also note that the pasta dishes were all around $20, even the ones which did not contain meat (gnocchi and rigatoni are both $19). 

The dessert was looked amazing but we were stopped. We both agreed that when we go back we are going to split a lighter appetizer, split an entrée and then share a dessert.
author: Emma H.

description:
We had our first date night here a while back, first since moving to this side of town.  This is a charming place with genuine, familial hospitality with equally lovely cuisine.  Everything we had here was either good or great, from the creamy gnocchi to their heavenly tiramisu dessert. 

The end to the evening was memorable because they started blasting some famous 80's Italian pop singer and the older staff began to sing and dance naturally as they closed up shop.  My wife somehow knew the singer and bonded with our friendly waiter about the artist. Fun night.
author: Saminda W.

description:
I moved to Glen Park today and decided to explore the area. My boyfriend and I walked around the streets surrounding the Bart station and stumbled upon Manzoni. We were perplexed because the restaurant was right underneath a large sign that said "Dental." But the exterior was too cute to be a dental clinic and people were waiting in line to get in. So we decided to check it out.

When we got closer we saw the nice interior and the menu. I saw pesto on the menu so I immediately knew we had to eat there. My boyfriend got the ravioli and grilled eggplant roll with salmon. He loved the eggplant roll but wasn't a huge fan of the ravioli. I absolutely loved my pesto with handmade pasta. 

It was a nice dinner that we topped off by sharing a tasty tiramisu. Service was pretty good. Our food came out pretty quickly (but not so quick that it was like suspicious you know...)! 

We'll definitely come back again for a semi-special occasion
author: Julia C.

description: Me and my wife celebrated our anniversary and the experience was just delightful, delicious food and excellent excellent wine, their theramasu is to die for, very friendly staff, we were served by Marina who was the nicest server we ever had! you'll be lucky like us if you're ever there and served by her. Classic Italian music, we had fun listening to the staff speaking Italian.
author: Sami J.

description: This has been our go to restaurant for good Italian food but tonight was a real disappointment because the service was terrible. The older gentleman who works there was very rude and grumpy. And could we please get a smile and some help from the older woman who works there too? We've been here to eat lots of time and haven't encountered such a lack of professionalism before but really not sure we'll be spending our hard earned money here anymore. Guess it's just time to look for somewhere new for Italian food. Lots of choices in SF! No more referrals will be coming for this place anymore....
author: Susan W.

description: Really good Italian restaurant! All food was amazingly delicious. I wanted to say salads were my favorite... but pasta won a prize. I don't really like pasta but I ate all my husband's dish of pasta and couldn't stop myself. It was the best homemade pasta I've ever had. The service was outstanding. Very nice and professional waitresses.
author: Maia Z.

description: Nice ambiance, but the food was extremely bland. This celebrated pappardelle simply isn't very good.
author: Doctor L.

description: I had the pleasure of dining at Manzoni last night and it was an overall wonderful experience. Our waitress Marina was very attentive and kind. They have a vast selection of wine and after splitting a pasta dish and delicious steak with my date, we can't wait to come back!
author: Ryan B.

description:
I was expecting so much more.  I feel let down considering the high rating that Manzoni enjoys on YELP.
Wow--everything was off right from the start.  I had to send the Primitivo back--it was way too complex and yet quite dull at the same time.  The Chianti that they replaced it with was marginally better.
My eggplant roll-ups were bitter, tough, and off-tasting.  The sauce that they sat in was tasteless.
The mussels and clams tasted old, chewy and fishy.  The sauce was supposed to be spicy but it too was bland and watery.
My pappardelle with pork tasted like a watered down beef gravy with day old pork cubes.
The rigatoni with peas and sausage was awful.  The sausage tasted like crumbled up hot dogs.
I'm hoping that this was an off night.
Lupa, Bacco and Zero, Zero run circles around Manzoni.
Service was excellent and the restaurant itself is charming.  It was elbow to elbow packed and loud.
author: Thomas D.

description: Just down the hill from home, and a welcome addition to Glen Park.  Cozy, rustic room.  The food is wonderful!  I opted for a salad of romaine,tangerines, shaved parm....exceedingly fresh and crisp with a light dressing. I would order this again.  Primi was house made ravioli in a sauce that was so delicious that it is hard to describe.  The pasta was cooked a perfect al dente as well.  I would order this dish again.  The guy ordered lightly dressed  arugula,  shaved parm, and nuts.  It was as perfect as a salad gets. He ordered scampi and declared them superb (see picture).  Our waiter suggested the appropriate wine and it was perfect.  This is my new favorite Italian restaurant in SF.  Very good service as well.
author: Bleep S.

description:
A nice secluded spot out of the way of the noise of downtown, this cute vine covered restaurant delivers on the promise of memorable Italian food.

The burrata was incredible, just the right texture. 

The noodles were hand made and perfectly cooked and dressed in a subtle sauce. The shrimp was particularly well prepared, making for a harmonious dish. 

Service was so warm and friendly, it was a pleasant respite from harried wait staff at north beach locales.
author: Miles C.

description:
Hands down the best Pasta Puttanesca I've ever had. The red and white vongole pastas were no slouches, either.

We walked in on a whim on Friday night and had no problem getting a table. The service was friendly, and the settings were in the mode of an ideal rustic Italian eatery in a hidden residential neighborhood. I will surely be back to try all of their other pastas.
author: Ken H.

description:
We had a lovely dinner here!  Flavorful food, good service, and a pleasant ambiance.

My husband and I enjoyed the following dishes:

1) Tomato basil soup - good
2) Spinach fettuccine with spicy sausage - great 
3) Paparadelle with pork ragu - very good
4) Chocolate hazelnut budino - good

We also enjoyed our glasses of wine - I had the chianti, and my husband had the Sangiovese that was one of the day's specials.

The service was friendly, attentive, and prompt.

The setting is pleasant - it's elegant yet "homey."  We had made reservations for our Friday night meal, but upon arrival, found there was plenty of seating.  We definitely got the impression it was a popular neighborhood spot.

Overall, a nice place to get a tasty meal at a low-key, reasonably priced spot.
author: Barnali D.

description: This is a true hidden gem in Glen Park village. The food is on point, think authentic Italian not a meatball and sphaghetti kind of joint. The wait staff is simply amazing. My four year old son loves, loves, loves Marina! He literally tells her he loves her and they always greet each other with big hugs. The decor is like straight out of a movie- you could easily imagine you're dining in an Italian grotto.
author: Luisa N.

description: This place's a gem. Went there with cousins of mine for dinner a week ago, and I can still recall the taste of the Fettucini. It was absolutely delicious, a real délice. The owners are also the nicest people-- would go again next time I'm in SF!
author: Ralph B.

description:
I lived in San Francisco for close to 4 years and regularly complained to friends about the lack of quality Italian food (there's good pizza if you know where to look *Mozzeria for thin crust and Little Star for deep dish* - I was complaining about actual sit down meals). About 3 years in, I was dead tired after work and accidentally missed my stop at Bart. So glad I did, as that's when I stumbled across Manzoni.

Manzoni is literally the best Italian food I've ever had in a restaurant, despite living in Boston (but still, eat in Boston's North End - very good) and having visited Rome, Bari and Florence. (The exception to "best I've ever had" was the Bistecca Fiorentina in Florence but I've been told that you can't get Bistecca Fiorentina outside of Florence. From what I've seen, that's true.) Specifically for a Manzoni meal, I recommend the Vitello al Prosciutto (I probably spelled that wrong, but it's the veal and prosciutto). For dessert, the affagato (I also probably spelled that wrong, but can pronounce it for sure ;).

The staff is amazing. The genuinely care about their customers. For example, one of my friends has a shellfish allergy but wanted a steak. Our server checked with the kitchen and let us know that shellfish was cooked on the same grill as the steak, so it's unadvisable for her to have steak. He offered multiple suggestions for alternatives. Someone overheard this conversation and recommended cooking the steak in a sauté pan instead of on the grill. Our server honestly (but politely) let us know that the steak would not be as satisfying sautéed and steered us clear of that recommendation.

Yes, you are going to spend *at least* $50 per person, should you get a meal, an alcoholic beverage, desert or appetizer, and tip properly (20% or higher). It's worth it though, whether you're on a date/anniversary, hosting friends from out of town, trying to impress, splurging for a birthday, or are just someone who's accustomed to that prices range. 

It's a small restaurant, which makes the setting intimate, but not uncomfortably so. If you have more than 2 people in your group, I highly recommend making a reservation, particularly during peak hours. (I don't remember what they are but Google will tell you.)
author: Ashley M.

description: Came here with family visiting from out of town.  Close to BART, but it was easy to find parking up the street.  Traditional Italian cuisine with a modern twist.  Everyone agreed that the pasta was excellent.  The tiramisu was also really delicious.  Reasonable prices, and warm, cozy atmosphere.  The waiters were from Italy and provided great service.
author: Ron C.

description: Small, intimate, tasty and BARTable!  We started out going to Manzoni as a consolation-- other nearby restaurants were closed on New Year's Eve, so we settled on this one.  It turned out to be a fortuitous find.  The atmosphere was friendly, homey and cozy with friendly servers.  We started with a salad with greens, grilled corn and shaved parmesan followed by an appetizer of involtini (grilled eggplant rolls with smoked salmon and cheese in a pepper sauce).  Our main course was roast chicken, which was flavorful, tender and juicy.  We'll definitely go back.
author: Glenn P.

description: Food are delicious!!!!! Love the fresh clam fettuccine;) Wonderful service, everyone there is super sweet!
author: Alison C.

description: Once we chose "tap water" over sparkling water (use of "tap water" obviously to make us feel cheap to have considered it) and passed on alcoholic beverages, our male waiter couldn't hide his displeasure. The service was hurried with major hints of impatience. Food: my ravioli was pretty good;my partner's pork, so so. Ambience: loud with no sound mitigation. Muffled music sounded more like spill over loud music from residence above. Maybe I'll be back one day since this is so close to home. I'll be hoping for better experience.
author: Demin G.

description:
Service was excellent our waiter made everything so easy. I'm still very new to wines and he was able to use a coffee analogy to help us find the perfect wine for our tastes. The food was also excellent and came out very fast  I will defiently be back in the future... it's. A great romantic date spot. 

You can also bring your own wine for $25 corkage
author: JD E.

description:
IF YOU DO NOT LIKE ALL CAPS, YOU SHOULD NOT EAT HERE, AT LEAST DURING PRIME DINING TIME, BECAUSE ON OUR VISIT, IT WAS THE LOUDEST RESTAURANT WE'VE EVER EATEN AT.

And the food did nothing to save it. So, will not be back.

It was actually physically painful.

You should always consider the context around people's comments:
We've been eating in SF restaurants for over two decades. We've eaten in all kinds of restaurants around the world, including (perhaps relevant to Manzoni's) numerous cities and little towns in Italy. We go see a lot of loud bands -- up close-- at the Independent, the Fillmore, Slims, GAMH and Club Deluxe. We're fine at the movies (had no problem listening to machine guns and explosions in "Hacksaw Ridge" or "Straight Outta Compton" in the big movie theater). But this was different. 

This was a hard-surface high-note kind of loud. Not because of music (I didn't hear any at Manzoni's), not just because of kitchen noise (we were closer to the front) not just because of the people who were eating there that night. 

We couldn't hear our own conversation easily, we couldn't hear much of the what the (gruff) waiter said. 

I'm no expert on how to fix this. Hanging fabric? Acoustic panels? Egg cartons stapled to the walls and ceiling? Figure it out before you scare aware more locals.

If the food was great we could just use an app and have it delivered to our home, but the food wasn't worth having again.

Like most large countries, Italy has regional variations on style. So maybe there are places I've yet to go where a pork ragù is a thin, relatively flavorless broth accompanied by tough, dry relatively flavorless cubes of meat. But I prefer what I've understood in my experience to be the traditional ragù (brasato or not)--a thicker, stewier sauce with ground/minced/chopped/shredded or just falling-apart meat that's inseparable from the sauce itself. And full of flavor.

Reviews suggest that others may have had a very different experience at this place, noise-wise or food-wise. I can only vouch for our experience, and just one night. But once was enough, so caveat emptor. Don't let the rustic rock facade fool you.
author: Brian C.

description:
Always passed by Manzoni and saw it to be more intimate and less rambunctious than the French restaurant around the corner (which by the way is delicious)...but for the sake of trying new foods, decided to go to Manzoni instead for my birthday.

I was not disappointed.

Started off our meal with the polenta and mushrooms - so good! The polenta is the perfect. Smooth and creamy with a textural surprise from the mushrooms. The use of gorgonzola cheese also added a little extra oomph to the dish to make it memorable.

For my entree, I went with the pappardelle. The sauce is light, almost like a tomato soup but went well with the braised pork. I loved it! Mom had the clam fettucini in white wine sauce and liked it too - she also appreciated the amount of clams and remarked that they were very fresh and sweet, still in shell. Dad had the rigatoni with Italian sausage; he also enjoyed his dish. I thought the sauce was a little strong, but that's my opinion

Ended our meal with the panna cotta. Perfect end. Not too sweet - very fragrant vanilla flavor balanced nicely with the more tart bing cherries and sauce. Did kind of have a cherry cold medicine taste though....just a fyi.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Seems like there are a lot of fans for this restaurant, but I just don't see why!
Came here this past Sunday for dinner, only a few tables were occupied but with high Yelp ratings, I walked in pretty confidently. I like the fact that we were given a choice of which table to sit at, but soon enough I knew service would be super slow. Two staff were at the back counter just chatting chatting away. We were not in a hurry and have been to Italy, so we know 'authentically', service should be slow because people in Italy take their time to eat meals over 2-3hr period.

Food- was okay. Not impressed. Read some great comments about their bread and olive oil, but I didn't think the bread was any special, actually not that good in my opinion. Mussels and clams in tomato sauce was standard. Spaghetti with anchovy/tomato sauce was a bit too salty, but the pasta itself was nice. Prawns was okay, lightly flavored, could tell it was most likely frozen. 

Ambience/decor- pretty big space with maybe 30-40 seats. A bit dimly lit, feels like it could be in Italy.

Service- friendly, but slow and appears not focused. We overheard the diner next to us got billed incorrectly, then when we got our bill, it was also incorrect. We were charged for an item that we did not order. A bit outrageous because we didn't order dessert after being presented with the dessert menu, the staff took the dessert menus back then brought us our check... And the added item was a dessert!!! What was she thinking?? She apologized and told us she mixed up our bill with the table next to us... But how could it be when the table next to us already paid and ordered all different items than us?? The only two waitstaff whom I think are the owners hung out at the back counter the majority of the time watching perhaps YouTube videos. I'm okay with slow service when staff are nice, but to get the bill wrong then to explain with an obvious untrue reason is a big turn off for me.

Overall, the food is okay, hence the three star rating from me, but there is no particular reason for me to choose to dine here again. Price vs. value/quality is not good either. So many other restaurants out there with better food and service!
author: Iris H.

description:
Food:
Gnocchi was delicious. Veal scaloppini was meh. It was juicy but a bit tasteless. Almond biscotti and panna cotta were good, and the chocolate hazelnut cake was divine! Only thing that really stood out for me.

Service:
Awful. Our waitress Mareena was very nice, but they were clearly understaffed, and she barely had any time to manage all her tables. The only other waiter completely ignored us when we tried to get his attention. He was rude when we asked him about ordering an additional entree, and he made us feel like we were offending him by trying to eat at his restaurant. It was quite unpleasant.

Will not be returning.
author: H L.

description: Went for dinner on a lark last week and was pleasantly surprised. This is the kind of place that can go either way. It's not a pro-experience, but everything we got was delicious, the staff was friendly, and the decent wine pirgram rounded off the experience.
author: Elguero s.

description: Love this place. Cozy atmosphere and delicious food. It's my special place for a romantic dinner.
author: Taisiya P.

description:
Twice I've come to this cute Italian restaurant and two things keep making me a repeat customer: 

1. customer service
2. rigatoni alla bischero (great flavor and creamy sauce, perfectly al dente pasta)

The decor and ambiance is perfect for a date or even a family outing (they've got long tables to accommodate). It's unassuming and easy to miss when you're walking by, but its setting in the quaint Glen Park area makes me feel like I'm eating in a quiet neighborhood in Italy.
author: Ting W.

description:
I've been in a 3 star rut for a while now. Trying to pick from 70+ pending reviews that are 2-3 stars to post is as depressing as pinching fat rolls and having to do the tripod bend when picking up something from the floor.

One of my gfs was visiting from Texas and wanted to have a group dinner. Her favorite cuisine is Italian. With a 4.5 star overall rating on Yelp, a quick walk from BART (~2.5 blocks), and easier parking than most parts of the city, Manzoni was an easy choice for our group dinner. Do make reservations as Manzoni is a small restaurant that can accommodate about 35 people. 

Manzoni serves up rustic, Italian dishes with reasonable prices and portions in a very warm and inviting environment. It's a charming neighborhood gem that's highly recommended for an intimate date. 

Our group of six shared the following apps:
*Parma Prosciutto & Burrata ($12): http://bit.ly/1x3mLmq
*House Cured Salmon Carpaccio w/ shaved fennel & meyer lemon dressing ($11): http://bit.ly/1zub1wL
Soft Polenta w/ wild mushrooms, fontina & gorgonzola ($9): http://bit.ly/1AbF0uT
*Mediterranean Mussels & Clams in Spicy Tomato Broth ($11): http://bit.ly/10qxeNm

From the apps I tried, the Polenta was my favorite as it was a stick to your ribs, hearty, cheesy, and earthy goodness. It's perfect cold weather food. Burrata is my vice and I just thought Manzoni's was just ok; I usually like burrata with a more milkier, creamier consistency. I appreciated that the House Cured Salmon wasn't too salty but I couldn't really detect any of the meyer lemon dressing. I didn't try the Mediterranean Mussels & Clams.

Oh and say, "YES TO THE BREAD"! We cleaned about six plates of it. The rosemary infused olive oil and balsamic vinegar dip was simply addicting. 

I had a hard time picking an entrée because I wanted pasta AND a meat dish but I thought about the depressing fat rolls and decided to just get a pasta dish. After much debate, I choose the Pappardelle w/ braised pork ragu ($17): http://bit.ly/1sdo5Pu. I was disappointed that the pappardelle were more like thick egg noodles than sheets of pasta (just my personal preference). The pork chunks were uber tender but the sauce was one-note and quite bland. Had this dish been stellar, this review would be 4.5 stars rounded up to 5 stars. 

Redeeming my mediocre entrée were the desserts. We shared the Eggless Vanilla Panna Cotta ($8.50), Hazelnut Budino ($9) & Tiramisu ($9): http://bit.ly/1uqWsIr. All were perfectly executed and equally delicious. The Panna Cotta was firm yet decadently creamy. The Hazelnut Budino was moist, chocolately, and nutty without being overly sweet. Loved the accompanying crème anglaise. If I had to pick a fav, it would have been the Tiramisu which had a great balance of coffee flavor, rum, mascarpone cheese and fluffy whip cream. It's the best Tiramisu I've had thus far and I get googly eyes just thinking about it.  

Service was most excellent and was everything you could ask for a neighborhood restaurant. Our server was friendly, attentive, and made great recs for the wine. Food service was timely. The owner even passed by several times to ensure everything was fine. We were the last ones to leave the restaurant but they didn't rush us out. 

Parking is becoming increasingly harder in the area so do allow yourself an extra 10 minutes to find street parking.

Everyone in our group left with happy bellies. I left with several. *Tripod bend*
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Unless you are looking for this place, Manzoni can be easily overlooked because it is further away from the Glen Park Bart station and right at the end of the businesses and the beginning of the residential area.  Despite living nearby, we only stumbled upon it as we were checking the other newer places that have opened up recently.  We finally found the opportunity to try it out last night.  We were a party of 4 and had a 6 pm reservation.  It is a very quaint restaurant with wood panel ceilings and the stone and brick wall is reminiscent of the family restaurants found in Italy.  The server, Mereena, was very good and offered great recommendations off the main menu and specials.  We ordered the endive salad and the faro and cucumber salad to share - both were excellent.  For entrees, we ordered the gnocchi, spaghetti puttanesca, the gamberino and fettucine vongole.  Everyone enjoyed their dishes.  We ended our meal by sharing 2 desserts (both homemade as we were told - $9 each) - the tiramisu and the hazelnut budino.  Again, very delicious.  
Bread and olive oil was brought for the table; water glasses were refilled without asking. The only area for improvement is their coffee - it tasted watered down and wasn't very flavorful. Overall, a very pleasant evening out with family, friends and good food.  The place is a little pricey for us, but well worth a splurge for a special or celebratory occasion.  We will definitely be back.
author: Will L.

description:
I want to like this place. The decor is plain and boring. It's more interesting towards the back but the front is like a hospital cafeteria. The staff is AWESOME and so nice and respectful. That's the best part. 

I want to go back but can't trust the food will be as good as the service. 

1. Have an interior design student help you make this more inviting. Plus when it's full the acoustics are harsh and makes you want to leave. There is a kitsch wine bar in San Mateo that you could mimic and tons of people would love it. Add character!! 

2. The food is basic. Bread is basic. It is all so basic. Eggplant roll is your killer app. Have more dishes that rock like that. 

3. Announce to the neighbors you did an overhaul and reopen. I'll help.
author: James T.

description: Fresh delicious homemade Italian resto, very charming & quaint. Reminds me of old italian home in Italy. I wish servings are larger! They are so good. Highly recommend for bringing your date over here
author: Taryn M.

description: Great Italian food. Attentive and knowledgeable wait staff. We have been many times and will definitely keep going.
author: Anya K.

description:
I came here for an intimate celebration. I was lucky to find parking nearby almost immediately. I'm not sure if there is too much parking.

When looking for the building, I was a little bit confused because the name of the restaurant doesn't really stick out. I thought a dentist building replaced it, but alas, it was to the left of the dentist building.

I walked in and we were seated. The restaurant itself is fairly cozy and quaint. Very cute. We opted for a window seat. 

We were handed menus and when I saw it, I recognized it as a fairly traditional Italian menu... in that there was a more extensive food hierarchy. (If you go to Italy, you'll understand what I mean.)

Started the night with a bottle of wine:
San Angelo's Pinot Grigio 2010 - $40 - This was very crisp and refreshing. Very delicious.  

Then the complimentary bread came out and the olive oil that came with it was DELICIOUS. 

Antipasti (Appetizers): 
---Mussels and Clams in Tomato sauce - Yum! One of my favourite dishes in general, and Manzoni's take on it was very traditional. Comes with 2 pieces of garlic bread. The base is yummy, and great to dip bread in.
---Polenta - Might be slightly different from how you've had it before, but this was very good.

Primi (First Course, generally pastas and the like):
---Rigatoni alla Bischero - This dish is good, but very very heavy. You'll need a stronger white wine, like a Chardonnay or something to pair with this.
---Ravioli alla Verdura con Carino - This dish isn't as heavy as the Rigatoni, and is very delicious. It comes with 6 pieces of Ravioli. I think these were eggplant filled.

Secondi (Generally a meat dish)
---Gamberoni al salmorigano - Prawns (6 pieces). This dish has candied potatoes which I'm not a big fan of, but the prawns were well cooked and yummy. The veggies I think had a hint of bitter (just a hint!) and was a good pairing with everything, especially to offset the candied potatoes.

Dessert:
Panna Cotta - I'm not a big fan of sweet stuff, but this actually wasn't overwhelming for me. It did make my wine a little bit more bitter though :p I enjoyed this dish, but I have no way of judging it because I'm not a big dessert eater.

Service:
Cute cute cute. The owner and his wife constantly checked up on us or had us in the corner of his eye to make sure we were okay. Refilled waters, and cleared dishes as we finished. He's the type of owner to really want to make sure you're at home. He makes you feel so at home, like a grandpa taking care of his grandchildren. He seems genuinely thankful towards each customer who comes in. 

Note: 
Each tier of food comes out after the prior one is finished. Thus if you don't finish your appetizers, your main dishes don't come out. And if you're primi isn't finished, your secondi doesn't come out; (they don't serve the pasta with the meat dish). In american culture, this is usually only reserved for fine dining, and in most asian cultures, this never happens.

Prices:
This is a bit more expensive, but not unreasonable. I think the prices were extremely fair. 

Summary:
I love love love this place, and I really hope to return sooner than later. I hope more people venture out here and try it. HIGHLY recommended and will return.
author: Kaje Y.

description: I've been here a few times because I live in the neighborhood. It does not disappoint!!! Give me that pesto pizza every night and I'd be happy. Great for a night where you're in the mood for a nice dinner. They do not take reservations so get there early or grab a drink at the Devine glen park station next door ;)
author: Rachel R.

description:
I've been going to Manzoni's for a few years now and they have always delivered incredible food, service, and atmosphere.

We often take people here from out of town and can honestly tell them every single item on the menu is incredible. I have had the pleasure of trying every appetizer and pasta dish multiple times and every single dish, every single time, continues to delight and amaze. My current favorites are the burrata and the ravioli, but keep your eyes on the changing special menu, which always delivers a treat.

The staff are also nice, attentive, and provide excellent wine recommendations (and stories!).

This is one of the gems of Glen Park.
author: Scott C.

description: We came here for my birthday and really enjoyed it! The decor is really nice and the service is great. I once worked as a waiter in an Italian restaurant and the chef used to make the best pasta putanesca, so when I saw it on the menu, I decided to eat there. You want find it in many restaurants. As it was, it was delicious. A close second to the original. My wife had the gnocchi, which was heavenly. Melt in your mouth! For dessert, we indulged in the butino, which was new for us. We really enjoyed that, too!
author: Tom M.

description: Was in the neighborhood craving for Italian food and found Manzonis. The restaurant is very cute inside and service was excellent. I ordered the rigatoni with Italian sausage and peas with a tomato cream sauce-- AMAZING!!! My boyfriend ordered the papardelle with beef- I have never seen him eat a pasta dish so fast. For dessert we had the panna cotta. Excellent as well! We will definitely be back.. this time I may consider ordering my own dessert so I won't have to share ;)
author: Shay E.

description:
Manzoni is brought to you by the talented family that runs Higher Grounds a block away (yummy crepes, btw.) A comfort to see their familiar faces! 

The stone exterior lacks proper signage, just know you're in the right place when you see the dental office next door. This rustic bistro's wood ceilings & stone & brick arch contributes to the feeling of being in a wine cellar (as observed by my oenophile Wonder Twin.) Ambiance is romantic enough for a date, sophisticated enough for a work dinner, yet unpretentious & perfect for an impromptu get-together like ours. 

The soft polenta antipasti ($9) had a blanket of gorgonzola & fontina cheeses covering it, giving each spoonful a salty, pungent bite. Enough meaty oyster mushrooms to lend texture to the otherwise smooth consistency. Addictive! 

Ruling out menu items & zeroing in on the one thing I'll eat is usually a simple process for me. So not the case here; between spaghetti puttanesca & the pappardelle special, it was difficult to decide. I finally scrapped those ideas & ordered potato gnocchi with a creamy cheese & truffle sauce ($17.) Savory & sharp flavors. Texture -- impossibly soft & pillowy. 

Our dinner left us too full for dessert. How I yearn to sit leisurely, post-meal, with a frothy espresso drink & a square of the tempting-looking tiramisu that almost every other table ordered. I must save room next time.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
This place is adorable! The ambiance is very romantic, as well. The lights are dim, but not too much. The restaurant reminds me of a cabin. There are real Italians making the food! Very nice and hospitable. I came with a few friends and enjoyed it. 

We ordered the clam linguine and the truffle gnocchi. My other friends ordered the rigatoni and risotto. The risotto took about 20 minutes, which they tell you ahead of time so don't be alarmed. The food was pretty good. It was in a very large portion! I had leftover gnocchi meal for another two meals. I will definitely recommend sharing or taking a look at the portion sizes before ordering a full plate. When I received my meal, the smell of truffle was so enticing! The cheese added was so creamy. I was in love before I even took a bite. I also enjoyed the rigatoni, very creamy. 

Cute place and the food is decently priced. There is also a lot of parking, which makes it convenient.
author: Lyra C.

description:
First off, have you seen the outside of this place? Cobblestone building? Trellis?! My god Romeo is about to come sprinting out of Glen Park Bart station this place is so cute!

This was my second time dining at Manzoni, so obvi it was good enough for me to come back for round dos. We ordered the polenta to start - twas' a bit liquidy, and the waiter was so kind to offer us another appeteaser free of charge instead. We opted for the prosciutto & burrata - DELISH. The cheese was creamy and fresh, as well as the meat.

For the main course, all three of us ordered the black truffle homemade gnocchi (we really branch out if you couldn't tell already). I've never had gnocchi so fluffy and light before! All of us gave it a 10/10. Must find way to blackmail chef for recipe.

To cap off the meal, we finished with the tiramisu. I was fighting the other two off for the last bite - I won.

Highly recommend!
author: Stephanie B.

description: Waitress was rude and not accommodating at all. It seems that their only focus was to fit as many diners into the space as possible and pay no attention to dinning experience.
author: Ecustomers S.

description: Came here on a date. The food is delicious but the tiramisu is amazing. The customer service is also great the owner and the waitress really checked in with us and made sure we were taken care of.
author: Shinesh P.

description: Came here for an early birthday dinner and had an amazing experience. I got the the ravioli with eggplant and it was delicious. The bread was great. And my mom and her friend enjoyed the wine. I plan on going back soon.
author: Victoria L.

description:
Fabulous!!!
Located in a cute neighborhood, not overly commercial yet not small-towny either, this restaurant felt both authentic and tasted delicious! My daughter and I ordered the Polenta, Sol with Rabe, Puttanesca, and Panna Cotta. 
The polenta came first. Normally, I'm not a big fan of polenta, but this time, I thought it was the highlight of the dinner. It was creamy and flavorful, with a hint of Gorgonzola. 
Next, there was my Sol with Rabe. The fish was super fresh and melted in your mouth, and the rabe was tender and slightly bitter. 
After, there was my daughters puttanesca. The pasta was al dente, and the olives and capers added a lot of flavor. Very good! 
Lastly, but not least, the was dessert: Panna Cotta! Delicious and definitely shareable. The Panna cotta was firm and creamy. A perfect end to a perfect dinner.
author: Madison W.

description:
Cher N. set up a group dinner for a bunch of us girlfriends + 1 manly man to catch up with a dear friend who had moved away for work. I'm very unfamiliar with Glen Park and had a long day at work with the 31st being Halloween AND the Giants parade. I couldn't even get home after the parade (delayed bus after delayed bus.. standing around for an hour? no thanks!), so I prayed Manzoni was just a short walk from BART.

Worry not folks! Manzoni is indeed, a short walk from the Glen Park BART station. It was about 4 short blocks. Parking can be tough, so if BART is easily accessible to you, TAKE IT.

The restaurant is small and cozy. All wood and brick interior. It's quiet and very casual, no need to dress up. (I guess I totally could have dined here in my Nyan Cat onesie costume.. just kidding. or am I?) Well, it seems like it is usually quiet in here, but I'm loud , SORRY! 

Great service. Our server recommended some great wines based off what we were looking for. Pretty attentive, my water glass was never empty. But I did tell them that I didn't need anymore water before we were completely done with our meal. (C'mon folks, get in the habit of doing that - we are in a drought!)  

We ordered a great variety from the menu. I would say we ordered most of their appetizers and desserts (haha) 

carpaccio di salmone con finocchio - salmon carpaccio with fennel. ehhh this was somewhat bland for me. I wish the fennel was more flavorful. 
parma prosciutto e burrata - prosciutto and burrata - I don't care for burrata. I enjoyed the prosciutto and arugula on this dish though. 
polenta alla valdostana - polenta with wild mushrooms , gorgonzola and fontina cheese - SO GOOD!!!!!! sort of stinky from the fontina but it's cheese, so it is the good stank. Loved all the mushrooms too. Creamy, earthy, cheese. YUMMMM
Mediterranean Mussels & Clams in Spicy Tomato Broth - my favorite appetizer that night. I kept hogging all the bread to dip in the tomato broth. Excellent. Loved that it was a mix of mussels and clams also. Perfectly cooked, plump and sweet. 

I had the spaghetti alla puttanesca. I love spaghetti. I especially love puttanesca sauce. Noodles were just right, great amount of olives in this dish but it needed a little more tang. Maybe more anchovy? The portion was huge. I really wanted to eat it all but I couldn't although I put up a damn good fight. I was sleepy toward the end of my meal. My gfs also loved their dishes and only ate half. They were smart and saved the rest for later. In retrospect, I probably should have done that but I am a carb wh0re. 

We had 3 desserts: Eggless Vanilla Panna Cotta, Hazelnut Budino & Tiramisu. If there's anything in life you shouldn't miss out on, it is Mazoni's eggless panna cotta. This thing is decadent. It is the way panna cotta should be. It is.. perfect. Thick but not too rich or overwhelming, not too sweet. Probably the best panna cotta I've ever had in my life (Sorry E Tutto Qua, your panna cotta is getting booted down to number 2) The tiramisu was standard, and the hazelnut budino was excellent.

All around I would say excellent food for the price and atmosphere. If you have a small group I would definitely make a reservation as this place is tiny. Thank you Cher for picking this spot!!!!!!!!
author: Susy C.

description:
Everyone who returns from Rome - or northern Italy - has withdrawal - from the food, atmosphere, and hours lingering over good food, wine, and conversation. So I tell my friends to bring their travel stories and meet me at Manzoni Restaurant, Manhal Jweinat's traditional trattoria in Glen Park, to extend their vacation just a little longer.
I live in the neighborhood but feel I have had a mini vacation each time I am there. I think I will try a new dish or two but often fall back on my favorite: pork pappardelle. But if Manhal has a special on the menu, especially if it's fish - I go for it and have never been disappointed. And if there is a recommended wine selection for the evening I trust him with that choice as well - since he has obviously thought about the pairing and the quality. Italy is not in my future right now, but I will be taking another trip in my mind this evening.
author: Lee G.

description:
We were excited to go to the new restaurant in our neighborhood, especially an Italian one! Unfortunately we were sorely disappointed all around.

Service was lacking: we didn't receive any kind of welcome from a hostess or from our waitress (who we were not introduced to), no check in to see how the food was at any point, I had to ask for the dessert menu myself (which she passed to us while disinterestedly talking to another waitress), and everything was slow even though we were seated at the bar.

The portion size of our mediocre food was  tiny, which we were very surprised by considering Italian places are usually overly hearty. My boyfriend literally left hungry after three courses. It's one thing to give a little bit of food if it blows your mind, it's quite another to give someone five just-ok ravioli -- and then charge them $20 for it.

I don't know if we've been going to too many good restaurants and our bar is set too high, or they gave us the cold shoulder because we are in our mid-twenties and younger than the rest of their clientele, but our visit was a waste of a night out.
author: Medina C.

description: A good place to go on a first date. It's a quaint little place. It has an old traditional family style atmosphere with a contemporary modern twist to the decor. We were seated near the window toward the front of the restaurant. We were able to carry a conversation without having to yell across the table. It was very romantic. The food was amazing and the servers were pleasant. I had a great time!
author: Toi E.

description:
Decent little joynt, serving up decent Italian fare by a competent staff.

The ambiance is terrific, especially for a date night setting.  

What a terrific little hood, that is Glen Park Village.
author: Anthony D.

description: I've been coming here since they opened and I must say the quality is going down consistently. I'm saying it because that's what happened to Chnnery Park and I don't want the same happen to these guys. The atmosphere and the staff are all great but the food quality is going down and it is at this point just OK. Anyway I'd love for you guys to be around a lot longer but please revamp your food so I would want to come back...
author: Lo F.

description: Just moved to Glen Park and gave Manzoni a try on Friday night and we were blown away!  We have lived in SF for a few years and tried many of the best Italian restaurants and this is in the top 2.  The service was friendly and attentive, atmosphere pleasant and warm, and the food...oh man the food...burrata actually done right (served room temperature with olive oil over thinly sliced prosciutto and arugula), risotto to die for, and ravioli in vodka sauce that rivals the best of NYC or South Philly.  Make a trip to Glen Park and go.
author: Lauren M.

description:
First time eating in Glen Park!

I was surprised to find so many restaurants in the Glen Park area as I usually don't come by very often. 

Manzoni offers a quiet, authentic Italian dining experience. I ordered the parpadelle with braised pork. The noodles tasted fresh, the pork was decent, and the sauce was flavorful. 

I also tried my friend's gnocchi with black truffle. The sauce seemed like an average white sauce and the black truffle flavor was light. However the gnocchi, was a little too soft for me
. 
Lastly, I ordered a tiramisu, which took a long time to get to me. The tiramisu was made very well: the mascarpone was light, the soak gave a really good flavor complement, and the lady fingers were perfect. 
I think it almost justifies the $9 per slice. 

Just a few recommendations:
-have a reservation. My friends didn't have to wait because there were some spaces at the bar. 
-parpadelle is good pasta option 
-tiramisu is really good if you're going for dessert. 
-they also have other desserts that looked very well plated.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Very nice! Cute little restaurant. Service was great and the food was great. I had the rigatoni and my partner had the pork medallions. There was a little too much spicey mustard on the pork that you ended up losing the flavor of the meat altogether, but it was still tasty. The pork came with roasted potatoes with rosemary and some roasted asparagus and carrots. Nicely presented!
My rigatoni was delicious. It had a creamy tomato sauce with sausage and peas. We also shared the arugula salad. It had roasted corn and a lemon vinaigrette. It was an interesting flavor. I enjoyed it.
Overall, a very nice experience. Not AMAZING, but I would definitely come again.
author: Joseph K.

description: Came here on a dinner date with the hubby on a Sunday night. We had the mushroom polenta, which was nice and creamy, not heavy like most polenta. I ordered the risotto with fava beans and cheese, while the hubby had the gnocchi. I loved the risotto, it was nice and delicate and loved my fav beans. However, neither my husband, nor myself, were crazy about the doughy gnocchi. Either way he ate the whole plate and he loved my risotto. The service was great, a little slow but wonderful and detailed to every table there. We would come back here again whenever we make it down the hill.
author: Carolina S.

description:
I'm a very particular person when it comes to Italian food, I grew up eating authentic and properly made Italian dishes. This place is amazing, the ambiance, the people and oh the food. 
We ordered 3 entrees the parpadelle, gnocchi and the New York steak. The parpadelle was amazing, the pork melted and the sauce was perfect. The gnocchi was earthy and rich but the texture was on point. The beef itself was great but the sauce was incredible. 
Then we ordered desserts: tiramisu, affogato and budino, all of them amazing, not too big but just the grand finale of a incredible meal. 

Can't wait to come back!
author: Belen P.

description: I can't find any reason not to give this place five stars.  We called at 6 and got a reservation at 7:45.  When we got there we were seated promptly.  The hostess was super welcoming.  After reading other reviews it looks like she was the owner.  Her husband suggested a great Pinot Grigio that we ended up getting a second bottle.  The food was decent portions and delicious.  We ordered the clams and mussels in tomato sauce and calamari salad for our apps.  The tomato sauce was awesome to soak your bread in!  We ate family style and got the veal, rigatoni, prawns and fettuccine with clams.  All the dishes were so good.  I would def eat here again the next time I'm in SF!  Great service, great food, clean and prompt.
author: Isabel K.

description: Pleasant atmosphere and friendly service. The food was decent, but did not "wow" us. Given the 4-star average rating, we were expecting much more. The radicchio, apple, and parmesan salad was OK, but the bean soup with farro was under-seasoned and did not have much flavor. Monkfish was good but not exceptional. We did quite enjoy the maltagliati with pesto - both the housemade pasta and the pesto sauce were spot on. We decided to cut our losses and skip dessert. We won't be going back.
author: David K.

description: A for effort. Nice ambiance and environment, but the food is somewhat middle of the road...Isn't really much to write home about. Lacks flavor and there's no pizza. Plus, they don't take AmEx. Nice wait staff and wine list.
author: Marissa W.

description:
Came here for a birthday dinner with a group of 9. The place was a little hard to find, but from a fellow yelper tip, it's under the dental office sign.

First off, the stars are subtracted mainly for the slow service. We go there at our reservation time, and had a table already set up for us. We were seated right away. Great start! But then it went downhill. It took them 30 mins just to start taking our order. The place was probably about 80% full, but still, come on. Once we finally ordered, it took a while for the bread to come out, which I don't understand, shouldn't it be readily available? Most importantly, we didn't get our dishes until 1+ hour  later!! And worst of all, the dishes were cold... Hmmmm. I understand that they wanted to wait for all dishes to come out at the same time, but still, this could be prevented or better organized. Hot dishes should not be served cold. 

I do have to give them props for one of the penne dishes that my friend got, not sure what's the name, but it was pretty delicious. The others were just okay (we like to family style, so got to try every dish our party got).
author: Sandy C.

description:
The most amazing Italian food I've ever had. Great service and a charming, clean venue (very quiet when we ate, about 6pm on a Wednesday night). We started our meal with a baby spinach/prosciutto/shaved parmesan/pine nut salad which was good but not worth ~9.50 IMO. The other dishes justified their price tag, however. I had the gnocchi with fontina cheese and black truffle sauce=to die for. My boyfriend had the riggatoni with tomato cream sauce and peas which was also super delicious. I can't find one negative thing to say about this place and highly recommend it.

Bonus: this place is only a couple short blocks from Glen Park BART station and next to a funky little neighborhood full of interesting architecture.. perfect for walking all that pasta off!
author: Nikki O.

description:
I'm pretty sure, Manzoni does 99% of his business from the neighborhood and doesn't need a Yelp review - but just in case you're searching for a neighborhood gem this is it. It's the only place I can bring out of town family to and advise them to order anything from the menu - it's all equally superb. Very friendly spot. At the end of the night, the stories come out, Manzoni has traveled for the love of food and wine. It feels special to be able to taste his curated menu.

The other friendly bit, is on weekends it's always 80-90% full, so the wait for a table is rarely all that long.

Manzoni, if you read Yelp reviews, the only change I might consider experimenting with is one dish for a rotating calorie-lighter 'for the locals' menu item. It would make it easier on the health-consciousness to eat out more often.

Thanks for all the positive contributions to the friendly atmosphere of the neighborhood and romantically scrumptious around the block dinners!
author: Boris K.

description: I really wanted to like this place more, since it's close to home and seems like a friendly neighborhood restaurant. Unfortunately we were underwhelmed by the dishes we ordered. The menu was quite limited and the food we had was a little bit bland. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't impressive. The service was very friendly and I'd probably give this place another shot... it's possible we just ordered the wrong thing!
author: Diana G.

description:
A friend and I visited tonight. This place had been recently returned to his list of acceptable restaurants following some bad service issues. I was looking forward to going there.

The service was seriously lacking. I'm not sure if they were short or if this is normal. The place was packed and there were 2 people. 

They forgot an appetizer and had to be reminded. Then my pasta arrived fairly raw. It was taken back. I can forgive that. However when 2 more tables received the same dish after mine was being corrected, I have problems. The food was ok, not stellar.

Had to keep asking for a refill on my water even though they kept walking by the table with the pitcher. My friend was never asked about a refill on his tea.

I think I can pass a return to this place.
author: Dave C.

description: This experience was phenomenal. The food being spot-on was just a plus. The service was impeccable, with friendly and traditional table side manner. The atmosphere was light hearted and authentic. my friend and I came in with medium expectations from the mixed reviews on Yelp. Honestly, this place doesn't need Yelp to draw a crowd, the man that runs it has a following of his own; one that he works hard and humbly for.
author: Anthony T.

description: In the 5 years we live here in the Diamond Heights/Glen Park neighborhoods, this is the first time we've eaten here.  And what a great decision we've made!!! We literally cleaned our plates and it may look to others during best by that we're pigs.  Great flavoring and a good enough portion.  We even ordered desserts and tat typically never happens when we eat out.  Perfect weather outside made the experience even that much enjoyable.
author: Justin L.

description: Friendly wait staff and creative delicious meals in an intimate yet casual atmosphere.
author: M T.

description: We had a reservation this evening via open table for three (made several days ago). It was early (6pm) and we were among the first patrons to arrive. The only table at which they would seat us was by the host station at the front door (opens frequently). We asked for a better table (all but two tables were vacant)and were refused. We are neighborhood people and have eaten here several times. The discourtesy (and on New Year's Eve-sigh) was amazing. We promptly left, and won't return.
author: Martha H.

description:
My husband & I came checked out this place last Friday night because of the great yelp reviews. We were lucky to find parking nearby. 
We ordered: 
Appetizer: Mediterranean Mussels & Clams in Spicy Tomato Broth for appetizer and it was very good. The best mussels I've ever had so far. 
Main Course: Fettuccini alle Vongole - it was okay, very light sauce. I ordered the special Risotto with prosciutto - it was also okay. Neither of the main dishes were great - only okay.
Desserts: Eggless Vanilla Panna Cotta - it was very good. Firm yet decadently creamy. Not too sweet. I really enjoyed it. Lastly, the Burdino (chocolate hazelnut). Too sweet for my taste and very nutty.
Overall, it was a great experience. Service was great and was everything you could ask for a neighborhood restaurant. Food service was timely. My husband & I left with happy bellies.
author: Jingle A.

description: I visited this restaurant for the first time tonight! It is really close to my house and the Glen Park Bart Station. The ambiance is really warm and cozy! The dishes are pricier than I was expecting with a two dollar sign rating, but the food was amazing. Excellent gnocchi and fettuccine! I definitely plan on coming back at some point.
author: Justin O.

description:
This is a cozy little spot that would work for a small group or a romantic date. The service is quick and generous with good complimentary bread (on the cold side, but still good).  My group ordered two pasta dishes and one fish dish. All three were very tasty with a good sized portion.
Marina was our waitress that night and she was the sweetest!
author: mary c.

description:
I ordered the sole special and my boyfriend ordered the pasta special. Neither of the dishes were great--only okay. We were surprised considering the great yelp reviews. 

More importantly, the restaurant felt understaffed with very slow service, so I won't be back.
author: Sara S.

description:
Nestled around a two block radius of Glen Park,
the center of my dining universe has, for some unknown reason,
conveniently converged.

There I find

a French place,

a taqueria,

a California cuisine place,

a Japanese place,

a pizza place,

a breakfast and lunch diner,

a cheese boutique,

a grocery store,

and now there is an Italian place.

Yes, parking can be challenging at times,
but knowing that your efforts will be rewarded
with delicious cuisine makes it so worth it.

Anyways, let's talk about the latest super star in my gastronomical cosmos - 

Manzoni.

When you first walk in
you can't help but notice the space itself
has a very warm and inviting feel to it
and is able to capture a beautiful balance between intimate
without feeling cramped and intrusive to the other guests.

The service is equally warm and inviting.

Our waitress turned out to be super informative about the food and of the restaurant.

We come to find out
that this place has been in the works for three years
and that the owner painstakingly designed the interior himself.

It's that same care and attention to detail which is reflected in the food.

The wife's pappardelle was cooked perfectly al dente and served with a rich and savory pork ragu.

The cheese filling in my ravioli coupled with its light almost sweet sauce was a nice contrast when the wife and I traded dishes.

We ended the meal with a very light and creamy tiramisu
and was a very pleasant way to end an enjoyable dinner.
author: Dan B.

description: My girlfriend and I have been coming here for a few years now. Manzoni is our "celebration" restaurant because it's one of our destination places when we have something to celebrate. We keep coming back for a variety of reasons. First, the feel of the restaurant just feels... right. It's like you're eating with family. Not grandma and grandpa, or your favorite aunt and uncle, but like the family you know pretty well, although you're not going to lie down on the floor and kick your shoes off. Also, the family that can cook. Seriously, just great flavors, well-balanced, each course sets you up for the next, and it's fun. Yep, just fun. The wait staff is fantastic and fun since they can authentically be themselves, and the owner is super charming and sweet. We really can't say enough about this place, other than we hope you'll love it too.
author: Yezin T.

description:
Pros:
Gnocchi! Is fantastic
Very attentive service
Casual & cozy ambiance
Quiet enough to have nice conversation

Cons
Parking can be difficult.  (We parked 2 blocks away and walked down the hill)
I ate too much and now my stomach hurts
author: Jane T.

description: This place is so good that it is my go to place for any special occasion.  The food is excellent.  I prefer the pastas to any in the city. The atmosphere is so comfortable.  The owner always greets us when we come. Best rating!!
author: Rj H.

description: Delicious food, wonderful ambient, true Italy! Loved the experience, and owner is a wonderful man.
author: Baharak A.

description: Some of the food was good and well presented- burrata appetizer was very good, but the pork pappardelle below par and the noise level too much to carry a conversation.  The wait staff seemed disorganized and too hurried. Two at our table finished before the 3rd diner in our party and instantly the 2 plates were removed leaving the 3rd diner eating alone. The dessert was ordered and arrived - no one ask about coffee - had to flag them down to order coffee. Our waitress was pleasant and attentive, but no real sense of caring if we were happy or not. Very uncomfortable - will not go back.
author: Jennifer M.

description: This is a very cute little italian place. It was cozy and classy and authentic italian at the same time. The food was very tasty. The place is a little tight though when they get super busy and the wait was a little long. Overall my experience was great.
author: Arda S.

description:
We have been to Manzoni several times, most recently last week for my four-year-old daughter's birthday dinner with her grandparents. The food is always great and we love the personal service given by the owners Marina and Manhal. Although its white table cloths, they are very accommodating for children. A great place to introduce children to a formal dining experience.

A very big plus is the small but very tasty and moderately priced (for SF0 wine list (most are Italian). We love the burrata apptz, gnocchi, rigatoni and the veal scaloppini. This is not high-end Italian cuisine but your not paying high-end prices either. I'm amazed that this restaurant is not full every night but I guess that is what you get when your in Glen Park. If I lived in other parts of the city, I'd come here as parking is easy and its only a block from BART.
author: Michael M.

description: First time here, staffs are friendly.  Love their homemade pasta and tiramisu.  Will come back for more pastas.
author: Cora L.

description: Great date spot- make sure if you want meat rare to really stress that otherwise it'll be a little over cooked. Pork medallions were great, and the wine was great!
author: Liza S.

description:
If you live in the area you might be familiar with Higher Grounds, the cafe that serves the best crepes and omelettes in Glen Park. Unsurprisingly, Manzoni is the same owners / run by the same family, and you get the same quality and warm, unpretentious, excellent service. 

Kendra was our server and she was so sweet and helpful with our wine choosing and recommendations. We had the special salad, which came with fennel / mozz / brown rice / cucumbers and was delicious. The bread is really good, an interesting harder yet squashier texture that I really enjoyed. I got the prawns dish, which comes with broccoli rabe and potatoes, and my friend got the new york steak which comes with brussels sprouts and potatoes. It was all filling and delicious and well-made, and we felt really relaxed and at-ease even when they were clearly closing and we were still in the middle of our meal. The owner was enjoying a glass of wine as well and chatted with us a little.

A class act and neighborhood gem.
author: Sonya Z.

description: Wow! I mean wow! This is the best food I have ever had in my entire life! If I had to spit this food out and eat it again, I would.
author: Leon X.

description: Very cute little restaurant. They had gluten free pasta and a cream free tomato sauce to meet my dietary restrictions. It was very delicious, although portions are small for the first entree so I recommend keeping in mind of getting a second, main course entree or getting an appetizer. Dress is casual and it's definitely worth your time and money.
author: Veronica V.

description:
I gave it 2 stars with a caveat ....  Four of us had dinner this past Saturday night.  The food was very good and the ambiance was nice.  We actually enjoyed the evening for the most part.

I think this is a family run restaurant but not sure.  An older gentleman served us (who I assumed was an owner/family).  He was nice.  However, while he was serving our appetizers, he accidentally knocked over my wifes full glass of ice water which went all over the table, as well as her lap and mine.  He apologized and cleaned up the mess with the help of 2 other women in the restaurant.  We felt bad as we knew it was accident but he never offered to even comp a single appetizert of the 3 that we ordered in good faith.  We ordered dessert at the end of dinner as well which we ended up paying for.  I think I would have have been fine with the accident if there was some appreciation shown for his clumziness.  Unfortunately, the lack of customer appreciation and service only warrants 2 stars from me....
author: Neil L.

description:
Impeccable food and experience. Came here last night for my Dad's 76th birthday. 

Sorry dad, they know how young you are now. 

They had a table waiting for us. Fresh bread perfect with olive oil. Salads came in ample portions. Entree flavors shined. 

Service marks high here, too. Dad requested a cushion for the chair - he is 76. They didn't have one, though waiter said he lived upstairs and brought down one of his own. 

Try it.
author: ciara c.

description:
This place is awesome!  I went there because a family member selected it for his graduation celebration. When I first looked at the menu online I wasn't overly excited because I like pretty traditional Italian food. The menu seemed a bit fancy which usually leads to disappointment based on lofty expectations. I was completely wrong. Manzoni does a great job of taking traditional meals and putting a great spin on them. The portion sizes were big. I had a chance to try the rigatoni and steak. The steak was amazing and the rigatoni was the best I ever had (and I've had a lot). 

The only bad thing is that I'm not from San Francisco so I won't be able to visit again for a long time. 

The owner was heavily involved in the experience for all the tables. Oh yea, we also brought three kids under 7 late at night and they couldn't have been any more accommodating.
author: Dan F.

description:
Inarguably the best restaurant in Glen Park. The intimacy of the space, the fantastic Italian wine list, the quality of the entrees, and the friendliness of the staff make this place one of my favorite restaurants in SF. 

I highly recommend trying some of their whites (esp. the Gavi di Gavi). Their ravioli is delicious, as is their spaghetti. My boyfriend usually goes for the rigatoni or the pappardelle, which are also fantastic. We had their tiramisu tonight and it was excellent. 

This place always reminds me of the time I spent in Italy. It is a jewel.
author: Min L.

description:
I came here for an impromptu dinner last night, and had a great meal.  We split three items:

Arugula and Grilled Corn Salad
Pappardelle with Pork Ragu
Veal with Prosciutto and Provolone

They were all very good and we will definitely be back.
author: Karla R.

description: Friendly service, delicious fresh pasta, a fond memory that we'd like to repeat.
author: Mark A.

description:
3.5 rating
